text: All of the following are true about the spleen except:

A.text: In open circulation, penicillar arterioles dump blood directly into splenic cords

B.text: Stave cells present antigens to B lymphocytes in white pulp forming lymphoid nodules

C.text: White pulp provides a location for B cells to proliferate and differentiate

D.text: Reticulin fibers fill the stroma of the spleen like in lymph nodes

E.text: T cells surround arterioles in the spleen, known as periarteriole lymphatic sheaths (PALS)

text: During an infection, lymph nodes increase in size due to:

A.text: B cell proliferation forming lymphoid nodules (follicles) in the medulla

B.text: Enlargement of the subcapsular sinus with plasma cells

C.text: Antigen presentation by follicular dendritic cells to B cells in the cortex

D.text: Congestion of the medullary sinuses with antigen presenting cells (APCs)

E.text: Clonal proliferation of T cells in the cortex

text: An embryologic malformation in the 3rd pharyngeal (branchial) pouch results in decreased differentiation of thymic epithelial cells (TECs) leading to thymic hypoplasia. What pathology would you expect from this smaller thymus?

A.text: Decreased antigen-presentation to developing thymocytes in the medulla (positive selection) and the cortex (negative selection)

B.text: Increased tight barriers between peripheral blood and the thymic stroma

C.text: Failure of Hassall's (thymic) corpuscles to form leading to decreased cytokine production that promote the differentiation of T-lymphocytes

D.text: An abundance of T-lymphocytes leading to overactive adaptive immune responses and autoimmunity

E.text: Both A and C are possibilities

A.text: Function to increase efficiency of lymphoid nodule activity in the appendix

B.text: Concentrate antigens in basal intracellular pockets for antigen presenting cells (APCs)

C.text: Produce IgA mediating inflammatory reactions for defense of the mucosal surface

D.text: Produce hormones and other signaling molecules in response to antigen presentation in primary lymphoid organs
